column1: #Text=The Calcutta papers contain a government circular, addressed to the editors and proprietors of the various periodicals, giving them a very significant caution against indulging in comments on the half-batta question, as being calculated to excite a spirit of mutiny and discontent in the minds of the European soldiery.
#Text=These papers inform us of the loss of the Nelson, of Liverpool, and of the subsequent preservation of the crew.
#Text=The weather had again become particularly sultry, and the transition had of course been accompanied by an increase in feverish and other complaints.
#Text=We have a variety of commercial intelligence from China.
#Text=According to the last accounts from Canton, the demand for cotton twist had become considerable.
#Text=Every bale in the market had been purchased by merchants from the northern provinces.
#Text=Preference was given to low numbers, at 48 dollars.
#Text=The trade of cotton twist on yarn has been increasing from year to year.
